articles.author: Antonia Mortensen, Abby Baggini, Mariya Knight and Jeevan Ravindran, CNN
articles.title: 'Europe stands with you': EU leaders express solidarity with Ukraine after Zelensky meeting - CNN
articles.description: The Prime Ministers of Poland, Slovenia and the Czech Republic reaffirmed their support for Ukraine amid the ongoing Russian invasion during a meeting Tuesday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal in capital Kyiv.

articles.title: Mass. doctor on COVID-19 spike in some areas - WCVB Channel 5 Boston
articles.description: The number of COVID cases are rising again in the UK and in more than half of the countries in the European Union.Subscribe to WCVB on YouTube now for more: ...

articles.author: RNZ News
articles.title: Ukraine: 'Difficult and dangerous moment'- Russian air strikes bombard Kyiv - RNZ
articles.description: Russian air strikes and shelling smashed into buildings in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv as invading forces tightened their grip, and three European prime ministers were due to arrive in the city.
articles.content:
Russian air strikes and shelling smashed into buildings in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv on Tuesday as invading forces tightened their grip.

articles.author: Brenda Goodman and Deidre McPhillips, CNN
articles.title: What rising Covid-19 infections in the UK and Europe could mean for the US - CNN
articles.description: Two weeks after the United Kingdom dropped its last remaining Covid-19 mitigation measure -- a requirement that people who test positive for the virus isolate for five days -- the country is seeing cases and hospitalizations climb once again.

articles.title: After years of cuts, mortgage rates now on the way up - Independent.ie
articles.description: The warning signs have been there for a while that mortgage lending rates were about to rise. Central banks around the world, including the European Central Bank, have been indicating that they will increase their key lending rates for banks.
